Description: Papyrus (three fragments) written with black ink with demotic legal text on recto (19 ll.), verso pasted down. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Cession of the right of action on deeds of the property conveyed in no. 10533, ceded by Petenechtumin son of Patseous to Petearsemtheus son of Panobchunis. Date. lost, but doubtless of even date with 10533 viz. 19 Ptol. Alexander [...] wants to be re-mounted - a strip is lost shortly before the line-ends - & the right-hand strip is mounted 3 ll. too high".
Curator's comments: Cf. entry in www.trismegistos.org - DAHT. Edited in S.E. Thomas Cambridge PhD diss. Text 35 in Shore's Manuscript Catalogue of Demotic Gebelein Papyri in the British Museum. Publication in progress (S.E. Thomas).
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (624) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/624)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus Black ink Tabbed: kraft paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: kraft paper Object Priority: B Mount Priority: B Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: fair (incomplete)
